content.title: Rainfed Area Development
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.details: Rainfed Area Development (RAD) scheme was launched in 2014-15 to mainstream development of rainfed areas in a sustainable manner. It adopts an area-based approach, focuses on Integrated Farming System (IFS) for enhancing productivity and minimizing risks associated with climatic variability. Under this system, crops/ cropping system is integrated with activities like horticulture, livestock, fishery, agro-forestry, apiculture etc. to enable farmers not only in maximizing farm returns for sustaining livelihood, but also to mitigate the impacts of drought, flood or other extreme weather events with the income opportunity from allied activities during crop damage.
benefits: Enhanced agriculture productivity and overall remuneration in the rainfed areas.
Risk mitigation against climatic stress such as droughts and heat stress and crop failure.
Conservation of natural resources by soil fertility conservation, rainwater management, increased, etc.
Capacity building of farmers in the domain of improved agronomic practices & climate change mitigation.
Extensive support for Extensive Livestock Systems (health care, breeding, drinking water, fodder in commons, etc.)

Integrated value chain support systems to realize growth potential in pulses, millets and oilseeds-based farming production systems including infrastructure and processing facilities – focus on local markets.
Monetary support of Rs. 30,000/- per family for adoption of integrated farming systems.
eligibility: All farmers are eligible under the scheme.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested beneficiaries can get in touch with the District / Block Agriculture Officer to enquire about village/cluster’s eligibility for the scheme. If found eligible, the proposal will be forwarded to the State Level Sanctioning Committee (SLSC) chaired by Chief Secretary for consideration. Based on the approval of the SLSC, the project will be rolled out by the state government or state government appointed Project Promoter / Implementing agency.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance provided in the scheme?
faqs.answer: A financial assistance of up to Rs. 30,000/- per family can be given for adoption of integrated farming systems such as cultivating crops along with trees (agro forestry or horticulture) or undertaking at least any two activities out of fishery, apiculture, silage making & vermicomposting.

faqs.question: What is the maximum limit for the monetary assistance?
faqs.answer: A monetary support of Rs. 30,000/- per family for adoption of integrated farming systems. This amount is over and above any other assistance availed by other complimenting schemes.

faqs.question: Does the financial assistance vary according to the farmer’s landholding?
faqs.answer: The amount of assistance shall be uniform for all farmers irrespective of the size of their land holding.

faqs.question: Who can avail benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: All the farmers of the State & Union Territory are eligible to take the benefits of this scheme.

faqs.question: What activities are eligible for assistance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Integrated farming systems or combination of at least any two activities out of fishery, apiculture, silage making & vermicomposting.

faqs.question: Can I avail benefits under RAD scheme if I am already a beneficiary of PMKSY-WDC scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can avail, benefits under RAD are over and above PMKSY-WDC and other complimenting schemes.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: What documents are required for application?
faqs.answer: Once the cluster is identified by the state government for scheme implementation, they may ask for KYC documents (Aadhar, Voter Id, etc.), bank account details, photographs, land documents/ownership proofs and any other document on case to case basis.
